title: Simplifying Equation
text: The most straightforward way to find the x-intercepts is to find the factored form of the equation, if it is easily factorable, then set the factored form to zero and solve for $$x$$.

title: Factoring a Quadratic
text: When factoring, the quadratic is split up into the multiplication of two binomials, one with $$3x$$ and one with $$x$$.

title: Result of Factoring
text: What is the result when the quadratic is factored?

title: Zero Product Property
text: For two expressions multiplied to be equal to zero, one or the other must also be equal to zero. Set the binomials equal to zero and solve for the positive $$x$$.
